name: Verbal Abilities
def: Abilities that influence the acquisition and application of verbal information in problem solving

name: Reasoning Abilities
def: Abilities that influence the application and manipulation of information in problem solving

name: Quantitative Abilities
def: Abilities that influence the solution of problems involving mathematical relationships

name: Memory Abilities
def: Abilities related to the recall of available information

name: Perceptual Abilities
def: Abilities related to the acquisition and organization of visual information

name: Spatial Abilities
def: Abilities related to the manipulation and organization of spatial information

name: Attentiveness
def: Abilities related to application of attention

name: Fine Manipulative Abilities
def: Abilities related to the manipulation of objects

name: Control Movement Abilities
def: Abilities related to the control and manipulation of objects in time and space

name: Reaction Time and Speed Abilities
def: Abilities related to speed of manipulation of objects

name: Physical Strength
def: Abilities related to the capacity to exert force

name: Endurance
def: The ability to exert oneself physically over long periods without getting out of breath

name: Flexibility, Balance and Coordination
def: Abilities related to the control of gross body movements

name: Visual Abilities
def: Abilities related to visual sensory input

name: Auditory and Speech Abilities
def: Abilities related to auditory and oral input

name: Oral Comprehension
def: The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

name: Written Comprehension
def: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

name: Oral Expression
def: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

name: Written Expression
def: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.

name: Fluency of Ideas Abilities
def: The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

name: Originality
def: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.

name: Problem Sensitivity
def: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.

name: Deductive Reasoning
def: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

name: Inductive Reasoning
def: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).

name: Information Ordering
def: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).

name: Category Flexibility
def: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways.

name: Mathematical Reasoning
def: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

name: Number Facility
def: The ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and correctly.

name: Memorization Abilities
def: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, and procedures.

name: Speed of Closure
def: The ability to quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.

name: Flexibility of Closure
def: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern (a figure, object, word, or sound) that is hidden in other distracting material.

name: Perceptual Speed
def: The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns. The things to be compared may be presented at the same time or one after the other. This ability also includes comparing a presented object with a remembered object.

name: Spatial Orientation Abilities
def: The ability to know your location in relation to the environment or to know where other objects are in relation to you.

name: Visualization Abilities
def: The ability to imagine how something will look after it is moved around or when its parts are moved or rearranged.

name: Selective Attention
def: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

name: Time Sharing Abilities
def: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information (such as speech, sounds, touch, or other sources).

name: Arm-Hand Steadiness
def: The ability to keep your hand and arm steady while moving your arm or while holding your arm and hand in one position.

name: Manual Dexterity
def: The ability to quickly move your hand, your hand together with your arm, or your two hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble objects.

name: Finger Dexterity
def: The ability to make precisely coordinated movements of the fingers of one or both hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble very small objects.

name: Control Precision
def: The ability to quickly and repeatedly adjust the controls of a machine or a vehicle to exact positions.

name: Multilimb Coordination
def: The ability to coordinate two or more limbs (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while sitting, standing, or lying down. It does not involve performing the activities while the whole body is in motion.

name: Response Orientation
def: The ability to choose quickly between two or more movements in response to two or more different signals (lights, sounds, pictures). It includes the speed with which the correct response is started with the hand, foot, or other body part.

name: Rate Control
def: The ability to time your movements or the movement of a piece of equipment in anticipation of changes in the speed and/or direction of a moving object or scene.

name: Reaction Time
def: The ability to quickly respond (with the hand, finger, or foot) to a signal (sound, light, picture) when it appears.

name: Wrist-Finger Speed
def: The ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists.

name: Speed of Limb Movement
def: The ability to quickly move the arms and legs.

name: Static Strength
def: The ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects.

name: Explosive Strength
def: The ability to use short bursts of muscle force to propel oneself (as in jumping or sprinting), or to throw an object.

name: Dynamic Strength
def: The ability to exert muscle force repeatedly or continuously over time. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue.

name: Trunk Strength
def: The ability to use your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time without 'giving out' or fatiguing.

name: Stamina
def: The ability to exert yourself physically over long periods of time without getting winded or out of breath.

name: Extent Flexibility
def: The ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms, and/or legs.

name: Dynamic Flexibility
def: The ability to quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out with your body, arms, and/or legs.

name: Gross Body Coordination
def: The ability to coordinate the movement of your arms, legs, and torso together when the whole body is in motion.

name: Gross Body Equilibrium
def: The ability to keep or regain your body balance or stay upright when in an unstable position.

name: Near Vision
def: The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).

name: Far Vision
def: The ability to see details at a distance.

name: Visual Color Discrimination
def: The ability to match or detect differences between colors, including shades of color and brightness.

name: Night Vision
def: The ability to see under low light conditions.

name: Peripheral Vision
def: The ability to see objects or movement of objects to one's side when the eyes are looking ahead.

name: Depth Perception
def: The ability to judge which of several objects is closer or farther away from you, or to judge the distance between you and an object.

name: Glare Sensitivity
def: The ability to see objects in the presence of glare or bright lighting.

name: Hearing Sensitivity
def: The ability to detect or tell the differences between sounds that vary in pitch and loudness.

name: Auditory Attention
def: The ability to focus on a single source of sound in the presence of other distracting sounds.

name: Sound Localization
def: The ability to tell the direction from which a sound originated.

name: Speech Recognition
def: The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.

name: Speech Clarity
def: The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

name: Administration and Management
def: Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.

name: Arts and Humanities
def: Knowledge of facts and principles related to the branches of learning concerned with human thought, language, and the arts.

name: Biology
def: Knowledge of plant and animal organisms, their tissues, cells, functions, interdependencies, and interactions with each other and the environment.

name: Building and Construction
def: Knowledge of materials, methods, and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures such as highways and roads.

name: Business and Management
def: Knowledge of principles and facts related to business administration and accounting, human and material resource management in organizations, sales and marketing, economics, and office information and organizing systems

name: Chemistry
def: Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods.

name: Clergy
def: Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, stenography and transcription, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.

name: Communications
def: Knowledge of the science and art of delivering information

name: Communications and Media
def: Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.

name: Computers and Electronics
def: Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.

name: Customer and Personal Service
def: Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

name: Design
def: Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.

name: Economics and Accounting
def: Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.

name: Education and Training
def: Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects.

name: Engineering and Technology
def: Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.

name: Engineering, Mechanics and Technology
def: Knowledge of the design, development, and application of technology for specific purposes.

name: Fine Arts
def: Knowledge of the theory and techniques required to compose, produce, and perform works of music, dance, visual arts, drama, and sculpture.

name: Food Production
def: Knowledge of techniques and equipment for planting, growing, and harvesting food products (both plant and animal) for consumption, including storage/handling techniques.

name: Geography
def: Knowledge of principles and methods for describing the features of land, sea, and air masses, including their physical characteristics, locations, interrelationships, and distribution of plant, animal, and human life.

name: Health Services
def: Knowledge of principles and facts regarding diagnosing, curing, and preventing disease, and improving and preserving physical and mental health and well-being

name: History and Archeology
def: Knowledge of historical events and their causes, indicators, and effects on civilizations and cultures.

name: Law and Government
def: Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.

name: Law and Public Safety
def: Knowledge of regulations and methods for maintaining people and property free from danger, injury, or damage; the rules of public conduct established and enforced by legislation, and the political process establishing such rules.

name: Manufacturnig and Production
def: Knowledge of principles and facts related to the production, processing, storage, and distribution of manufactured and agricultural goods

name: Mathematics and Science
def: Knowledge of the history, theories, methods, and applications of the physical, biological, social, mathematical, and geography

name: Mathematics
def: Knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and their applications.

name: Mechanics
def: Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance.

name: Medicine and Dentistry
def: Knowledge of the information and techniques needed to diagnose and treat human injuries, diseases, and deformities. This includes symptoms, treatment alternatives, drug properties and interactions, and preventive health-care measures.

name: Personnel and Human Resources
def: Knowledge of principles and procedures for personnel recruitment, selection, training, compensation and benefits, labor relations and negotiation, and personnel information systems.

name: Philosophy and Theology
def: Knowledge of different philosophical systems and religions. This includes their basic principles, values, ethics, ways of thinking, customs, practices, and their impact on human culture.

name: Physics
def: Knowledge and prediction of physical principles, laws, their interrelationships, and applications to understanding fluid, material, and atmospheric dynamics, and mechanical, electrical, atomic and sub- atomic structures and processes.

name: Production and Processing
def: Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods.

name: Psychology
def: Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; learning and motivation; psychological research methods; and the assessment and treatment of behavioral and affective disorders.

name: Public Safety and Security
def: Knowledge of relevant equipment, policies, procedures, and strategies to promote effective local, state, or national security operations for the protection of people, data, property, and institutions.

name: Sales and Marketing
def: Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services. This includes marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems.

name: Sociology and Anthropology
def: Knowledge of group behavior and dynamics, societal trends and influences, human migrations, ethnicity, cultures and their history and origins.

name: Telecommunications
def: Knowledge of transmission, broadcasting, switching, control, and operation of telecommunications systems.

name: Therapy and Counseling
def: Knowledge of principles, methods, and procedures for diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of physical and mental dysfunctions, and for career counseling and guidance.

name: Transportation
def: Knowledge of principles and methods for moving people or goods by air, rail, sea, or road, including the relative costs and benefits.

name: Basic Skills (Content)
def: Developed capacities that facilitate learning or the more rapid acquisition of knowledge

name: Basic Skills (Process)
def: Developed capacities that facilitate learning or the more rapid acquisition of knowledge

name: Social Skills
def: Developed capacities used to work with people to achieve goals

name: Complex Problem Solving
def: Developed capacities used to solve novel, ill-defined problems in complex, real-world settings

name: Technical Skills
def: Developed capacities used to design, set-up, operate, and correct malfunctions involving application of machines or technological systems

name: Systems Skills
def: Developed capacities used to understand, monitor, and improve socio-technical systems

name: Resource Management
def: Developed capacities used to allocate resources efficiently

name: Active Learning
def: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

name: Active Listening
def: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

name: Critical Thinking
def: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

name: Learning Strategies
def: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

name: Mathematics
def: Using mathematics to solve problems.

name: Monitoring
def: Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

name: Reading Comprehension
def: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

name: Science
def: Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

name: Speaking
def: Talking to others to convey information effectively.

name: Writing
def: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

name: Coordination
def: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

name: Instructing
def: Teaching others how to do something.

name: Negotiation
def: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

name: Persuasion
def: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

name: Service Orientation
def: Actively looking for ways to help people.

name: Social Perceptiveness
def: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

name: Equipment Maintenance
def: Performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

name: Equipment Selection
def: Determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

name: Installation
def: Installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

name: Operation and Control
def: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

name: Operation Monitoring
def: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

name: Operations Analysis
def: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

name: Programming
def: Writing computer programs for various purposes.

name: Quality Control Analysis
def: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

name: Repairing
def: Repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

name: Technology Design
def: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

name: Troubleshooting
def: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

name: Judgment and Decision Making
def: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

name: Systems Analysis
def: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

name: Systems Evaluation
def: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

name: Management of Financial Resources
def: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

name: Management of Material Resources
def: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

name: Management of Personnel Resources
def: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.

name: Time Management
def: Managing one's own time and the time of others.
